text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- A house belonging to Olu of Warri, the traditional ruler of the midwestern Nigerian oil city, burnt down in clashes between Ijaw and Itsekiri tribes over relocation of a local government council.
- State oil firm NNPC may increase pump prices following the recent petrol shortage when motorists showed they could afford to pay well above the official price for fuel.
- Five people killed in latest clash between Ijaw and Itsekiri youths in Warri oil city. Arsonists sack village.
- Federal government may crack down on campaigners calling on military ruler General Sani Abacha to contest next year's presidential election.
- Finance minister Anthony Ani says tight monetary policy of government is aimed at achieving macroeconomic stability followed by sustained growth.
- Politicians want governorship and legislative elections scheduled for later this year to be held on the same day to cut costs.
